short: When you make a cogent argument, it means your argument is clear and persuasive. In these days of 24-hour entertainment news and sound-bite sized explanations of complex government policy, itās hard to find a cogent argument amidst all the emotional outbursts.
long: Cogent comes from a Latin word meaning to drive together, so cogent thinking is well-organized: it hangs together.
